A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This film took on the impossible task of fulfilling massive fan expectations\, remaining true to a decades old franchise\, carving a new and exciting direction for the story\, and being generally appealing to a wide audience. I applaud Rian Johnson for choosing to make a film that meant something in addition to being entertaining. This film not only has great epic star wars battles and the quirky humor that has ALWAYS been a part of the franchise\, but also comments on the arrogance of risk taking male commanders\, the familiar and wretched economy behind the military industrial complex\, and in reworking our understanding of the force\, opens up the dream of saving the Galaxy to those whose name is not \"Skywalker.\"
